result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joseph E. Schneider in court with attorney Brent Wayne Varner.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to terminate DPA.  Atty Varner does not object.  Court grants the State's motion to revoke DPA.  VIS reviewed by all parties.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Defendant Joseph E. Schneider in court.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Brent Varner, PO Box 661 Sauk City WI  592-2489 @$65/hr @ $50.00 /month commencing Nov 1, 2017 and monthly thereafter.
Indigency hearing on October 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 24, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph E. Schneider in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes matter is in Court today on a motion to revoke the DPA.  Court questions DE re: counsel.  DE states PD's office denied him and he just found out today he can apply through the court for appointed counsel.  Court advises DE to get IH paperwork from her assistant.  Matter reset.  Bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
